title: Calories in Canned Corn
meta_description: Discover calories in canned corn per cup serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium details, and easy tweaks for your diet.
assumptions: Drained solids, standard sweet corn variety, with added salt; 1 cup â‰ˆ 165 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sodium content, draining method, and whether low-sodium or organic; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of drained canned corn provides ~132 kcal and ~4.3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of canned corn?
faqs.a: About 132 kcal for 1 drained cup (165 g).

faqs.q: Is canned corn high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, standard versions have ~465 mg sodium per cup due to added salt; opt for low-sodium to reduce.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in canned corn?
faqs.a: Around 31 g total carbs per cup, including 4.5 g fiber and 8.9 g sugars.

faqs.q: Calories in canned vs fresh corn?
faqs.a: Canned is similar (~80 kcal/100 g), but fresh may have slightly more fiber and less sodium.

faqs.q: Does draining canned corn affect calories?
faqs.a: Minimal impact on calories, but reduces sodium by up to 40% if rinsed.
